channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10297] LoadAndVerify Integration Test for cell visibility
item.summary: LoadAndVerify Integration Test for cell visibility

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12621921/HBASE-10297.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12621921

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop1.1. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.1 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

-1 release audit. The applied patch generated 4 release audit warnings (more than the trunk's current 0 warnings).

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ for (long idxInBlock = 0; idxInBlock < BLOCK_SIZE && i < recordsToWrite; idxInBlock+, i+) {
+ .println(" -Dloadmapper.num_to_write=<n> Number of rows per mapper (default 100,000 per mapper)");
+ .println(" -Dloadmapper.numPresplits=<n> Number of presplit regions to start with (default 40)");
+ .println(" -Dverify.scannercaching=<n> Number hbase scanner caching rows to read (default 50)");

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8359//testReport/
Release audit warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8359//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/patchReleaseAuditProblems.txt

Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8359//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8359//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8359//console

This message is automatically generated.

This fixes the line length >100 issues.

https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8359//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/patchReleaseAuditProblems.txt
These not related to this patch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12621935/HBASE-10297_V2.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12621935

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop1.1. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.1 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

-1 release audit. The applied patch generated 4 release audit warnings (more than the trunk's current 0 warnings).

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestAssignmentManagerOnCluster
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TestIOFencing

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8362//testReport/

+1

I don't think the test failures are related, but perhaps run HadoopQA one more time.

The Javadoc for the test needs updating to describe what additional things this new integration test checks for. Can be done at commit time.

This message is automatically generated.
Committed to 0.98 and Trunk. Thanks Ram, Andy for your reviews.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #4801 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/4801/)
HBASE-10297 LoadAndVerify Integration Test for cell visibility (anoopsamjohn: rev 1556770)

  • /hbase/trunk/hbase-it/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/test/IntegrationTestLoadAndVerify.java
  • /hbase/trunk/hbase-it/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/test/IntegrationTestWithCellVisibilityLoadAndVerify.java

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-0.98 #65 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98/65/)
HBASE-10297 LoadAndVerify Integration Test for cell visibility (anoopsamjohn: rev 1556771)

  • /hbase/branches/0.98/hbase-it/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/test/IntegrationTestLoadAndVerify.java
  • /hbase/branches/0.98/hbase-it/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/test/IntegrationTestWithCellVisibilityLoadAndVerify.java

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1 #59 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/59/)
HBASE-10297 LoadAndVerify Integration Test for cell visibility (anoopsamjohn: rev 1556771)

  • /hbase/branches/0.98/hbase-it/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/test/IntegrationTestLoadAndVerify.java
  • /hbase/branches/0.98/hbase-it/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/test/IntegrationTestWithCellVisibilityLoadAndVerify.java

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK-on-Hadoop-1.1 #47 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK-on-Hadoop-1.1/47/)
HBASE-10297 LoadAndVerify Integration Test for cell visibility (anoopsamjohn: rev 1556770)

  • /hbase/trunk/hbase-it/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/test/IntegrationTestLoadAndVerify.java
  • /hbase/trunk/hbase-it/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/test/IntegrationTestWithCellVisibilityLoadAndVerify.java

I think this test also does not work with mvn verify 


 mvn verify -Dit.test=IntegrationTestWithCellVisibilityLoadAndVerify -Dtest.output.tofile=false

I think this test also does not work with mvn verify

mvn verify -Dit.test=IntegrationTestWithCellVisibilityLoadAndVerify -Dtest.output.tofile=false

Confirmed. The test creates a user that is not real, 'user1' while the process is running as user 'apurtell'. There is an inevitable permission problem.

[...]

2014-07-10 13:30:36,504 ERROR [IPC Server handler 0 on 43020] security.UserGroupInformation(1494): PriviledgedActionException as:user1 (auth:SIMPLE) cause:org.apache.hadoop.security.AccessControlException: Permission denied: user=user1, access=WRITE, inode="/user":apurtell:supergroup:drwxr-xr-x

[...]



Results :



Failed tests:   testLoadAndVerify(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.test.IntegrationTestWithCellVisibilityLoadAndVerify)



Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0

Let's fix it. Reopening. Please close again after addendum commit or if opening a new JIRA to deal with the issue.

But the above permission problem happens only when run with minicluster Andy. Not when run in a real cluster. In real cluster the only thing we may need is have a user called 'user1'.
So with mvn verify what should we do to get it running ?

Since you can't assume there's a user in a real test cluster named 'user1' we need to parameterize what user names to use. So, some kind of command line option. For the minicluster test, automatically set that CLI option to the name of the current user.
Ram offline told me that he is having a patch for fixing the user issue. Let us fix that in another issue and close this as this was closed long time back.
